name: git_commit_assistant
purpose: Automate the git commit process by analyzing changes, generating appropriate commit messages following project conventions, and executing the commit with proper validation. The subagent will handle staged files, modified files, and conflicts according to specified rules.
input_requirements: Current git status showing staged and modified files
Git diff to understand the nature of modifications
process_steps: Run `git status` to identify staged files and modified files
If staged files exist AND no modified files have the same names → commit only staged files
If any file appears as both staged and modified → prompt parent agent for user decision
If no staged files exist → proceed with committing all changes
Analyze changes in selected files to understand the nature of modifications
Generate hierarchical commit message with intent and specific changes
Validate commit message and execute commit with proper error handling
expected_output: Successful git commit with hierarchical commit message
Detailed error information if commit fails
User prompt (via parent agent) when conflict situations arise
example_usage: task(subagent_type="general", prompt="Perform a git commit operation in the ESP32 filament dryer project. First check git status to identify staged vs modified files. If there are staged files without corresponding modified files, commit only those staged files. If the same file is both staged and modified, ask the parent agent for user input on how to proceed. If no files are staged, commit all changes. Generate a hierarchical commit message with bullet points describing the intent and subpoints describing specific changes made. Follow the project's conventional commit format.")
